key_points: CNN's Chris Cuomo reportedly received special COVID-19 testing due to his brother, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo.
An aide to New York's health commissioner administered the COVID-19 test at Chris Cuomo's home and expedited its processing.
The special treatment occurred in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic, around March last year.
Chris Cuomo had contracted COVID-19 and continued to anchor his show from quarantine.
Andrew Cuomo appeared on Chris Cuomo's CNN show several times, leading to ethical concerns.
CNN has since banned Andrew Cuomo from appearing on Chris Cuomo's show.
CNN defended Chris Cuomo's actions, stating he sought help during a critical time of the pandemic.
Rich Azzopardi, a spokesman for Gov. Andrew Cuomo, stated the administration helped many people get tested early in the pandemic.
Journalist Glenn Greenwald criticized Chris Cuomo's actions as an abuse of power.
Chris Cuomo is currently off-air but is expected to return to his show next Monday.
spokespersons: Rich Azzopardi (spokesman for Gov. Andrew Cuomo)
